title.narrative: CAPACITIES FOR IMPLEMENTAT. OF SOCIAL PROTECTION PROGRAMMES

description.narrative: Public and local institutions have increased capacities for the implementation of social protection programmes., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid), Children With Disabilities, Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children and vulnerable people have access to sustainable social protection programmes and are benefitting from increasedbudget allocations in the social sectors.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Public and local institutions have increased capacities for the implementation of social protection programmes.

description.narrative: L’appui fourni au Ministère de l’Action Sociale, de la promotion féminine et de l’enfance et aux acteurs nationaux de la protection sociale a permis de renforcer la synergie entre les parties prenantes et améliorer la prise en charge des personnes vulnérables, y compris en situation d’urgence. La synergie entre les principaux acteurs de la protection sociale a été renforcée. 2000 enfants vulnérables dans les 40 communes de convergence et 500 ménages affectés par Ebola ont reçu des transferts monétaires dans la région de Nzérékoré. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2022
